results.definition: deceive an opponent by a bold bet on an inferior hand with the result that the opponent withdraws a winning hand
very steep; having a prominent and almost vertical front
the act of bluffing in poker; deception by a false show of confidence in the strength of your cards
a high steep bank (usually formed by river erosion)
bluntly direct and outspoken but good-natured
examples: a bluff and rugged natural leader

results.definition: frighten someone by pretending to be stronger than one really is
pretense that your position is stronger than it really is
examples: his bluff succeeded in getting him accepted
